0780/A0/05/884/001.status_value: Score 3: Child-friendly principles are mostly incorporated into teacher training programmes  quality assurance guidelines  SMC training  and are implemented in most target schools. 0780/A0/05/884/001.target_value: Score 3: National quality standards on pedagogy  learning environment  school ethos and community involvement  and infrastructure and design are based on/reflect significantly most of the 4 CFS principles. 0780/A0/05/881/002.headline: UNICEF invested in innovative approaches to empower communities to address issues of undernutrition through strengthening mother support groups  formulating  around 2 800 mothers'/community groups  involving more than 30 000 families   and facilitating collective action to improve and monitor the nutritional status  in the communities.

0780/A0/05/882/001.status_value: To improve the quality of HMIS reports  a small-scale pilot was introduced on real-time monitoring on facility-based new born care services in 9 districts
0780/A0/05/882/001.indicator_name: Health Management Information System generates periodic reports with data disaggregated by age and sex (for relevant indicators) at national and sub-national level
0780/A0/05/882/001.headline: UNICEF Sri Lanka  which houses the South-to-South (S2S) Coordinator for Health  facilitates many exchanges and monitors the long-term outcomes from the S2S initiative promoting Sri Lanka as a mother and new-born health learning hub in the region.
0780/A0/05/882/001.baseline_value: The HMIS is functioning and generates routine periodic reports
0780/A0/05/882/001.target_value: HMIS generates real-time data on newborn care in all 25 districts

(Source:Youth Tracer study 2014)

0780/A0/05/800/001.indicator_name: % of direct cash transfers to partners outstanding for over 9 months

0780/A0/05/800/001.status_value: Seven implementing partners have been micro assessed during the year. Based on the revised HACT Protocol Framework  it was agreed that Implementing Partners that get Direct Cash Transfers in excess of US$ 100 000 will have an assumed Risk Rating of "High". Quality Assurance Financial Spot Checks will done as per the August 2014 guidelines from the Deputy Executive Director and based on the risk rating. Non Government Partners will be Micro Assessed
